result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:55 AM  Defendant Michael William Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Michael William Blackdeer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information.  DEF entered NG plea.

9:39 AM Defendant Michael William Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Michael William Blackdeer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State request Court take Judicial Notice of JOC's in cases  21CM157  21CM192, Attny Pollak no objection,  Court takes judicial notice.  State calls witness, Deputy Carter Hartling, sworn in by court.  State begins examination.    9:51 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  9:51 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.   9:54 AM Attny Pollak no further questions.  9:54 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak no argument.   Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Defendant Michael William Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) appears by video.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Warrant quashed.  State makes bond recommendation. CBS $2500.   Attny Pollak argues bond.   Court makes statement.  Court sets bond.   CBS $2500   DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.    Court sets preliminary hearing within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
